IssuesDiscovered.Title: Potential goroutine leak: no visible cleanup mechanism
IssuesDiscovered.Description:
At dynacache.go:313, goroutine launched without context or cleanup mechanism.

Goroutines should either: 1) Have a context.Context parameter and select on ctx.Done(), or 2) Have explicit shutdown channel. Otherwise they may leak when the program tries to exit.

IssuesDiscovered.Description:
Variable 'Unlock' is accessed by 2 different goroutines in deploy.go.

Shared variables accessed by multiple goroutines must be protected with sync.Mutex, sync.RWMutex, or accessed via channels/atomic operations to prevent race conditions.

IssuesDiscovered.Title: Potential race: assignment to 'errs' in goroutine
IssuesDiscovered.Description:
Variable 'errs' is assigned at deploy.go:213 inside a goroutine.

If this variable is accessed by multiple goroutines, the assignment must be protected by a mutex or use atomic operations.

IssuesDiscovered.Title: Potential race: assignment to 'errs' in goroutine
IssuesDiscovered.Description:
Variable 'errs' is assigned at deploy.go:247 inside a goroutine.

If this variable is accessed by multiple goroutines, the assignment must be protected by a mutex or use atomic operations.

IssuesDiscovered.Title: Potential goroutine leak: no visible cleanup mechanism
IssuesDiscovered.Description:
At deploy.go:209, goroutine launched without context or cleanup mechanism.

Goroutines should either: 1) Have a context.Context parameter and select on ctx.Done(), or 2) Have explicit shutdown channel. Otherwise they may leak when the program tries to exit.

At site_render.go:77, goroutine launched without context or cleanup mechanism.

Goroutines should either: 1) Have a context.Context parameter and select on ctx.Done(), or 2) Have explicit shutdown channel. Otherwise they may leak when the program tries to exit.

IssuesDiscovered.Title: Potential goroutine leak: no visible cleanup mechanism
IssuesDiscovered.Description:
At babel.go:196, goroutine launched without context or cleanup mechanism.

Goroutines should either: 1) Have a context.Context parameter and select on ctx.Done(), or 2) Have explicit shutdown channel. Otherwise they may leak when the program tries to exit.

IssuesDiscovered.Title: Potential goroutine leak: no visible cleanup mechanism
IssuesDiscovered.Description:
At batcher.go:55, goroutine launched without context or cleanup mechanism.

Goroutines should either: 1) Have a context.Context parameter and select on ctx.Done(), or 2) Have explicit shutdown channel. Otherwise they may leak when the program tries to exit.

Context: Analyzed 515 Go files for common bug patterns. Detected 682 potential issues.
Reasoning:
Based on philosophy: 'Common bug patterns indicate missing safeguards. Static analysis + AI catches more than linters alone'

Static analysis found patterns that often indicate bugs:
- Resource leaks can cause file descriptor exhaustion
- Ignored errors can hide failures
- Goroutine leaks waste memory and resources

AI should evaluate: Which of these are real bugs vs. acceptable patterns in context?
